channel.title: CMSC320 Introduction to Data Science
channel.description: Recent content on CMSC320 Introduction to Data Science

item.title: Homework 2: ER Model and SQL
item.description:
Practice making an ER diagram and writing SQL queries.

DUE: Tuesday Feb. 20, 11:59pm

item.title: Homework 1: Datatypes and Wrangling
item.description:
In this assignment, you will explore and exercise your knowledge of data types, data operations and data plotting.

DUE: Thursday Feb. 8, 11:59pm

item.title: Project 3: Classification and Regression
item.description: This project has two parts: a. Regression b. Classification Follow instructions on each of these two to complete your project. DUE Dec 2, 2016 Submission Prepare and knit a single Rmarkdown file that includes submission information described in each of the two project parts above. All axes in plots should be labeled in an informative manner. Your answers to any question that refers to a plot should include both (a) a text description of your plot, and (b) a sentence or two of interpretation as it relates to the question asked.

item.title: CMSC320 Projects
CMSC320 Resources
item.description: R R is an open-source environment for data analysis. The RStudio IDE is highly recommended. The Revolution IDE is also very good, only Linux and Windows. tidyverse is a collection of data science packages designed for consistency and interoperability. swirl is an interactive R (and general data analysis) tutorial Data Camp has a nice short online course introducing R R Task Views: The Machine Learning and Optimization Task Views list useful packages in R we may use.

item.title: Logistics
item.description: This page constiutes the official syllabus for this class. Course Information Introduction to Data Science CMSC320 Spring 2018 Lecture Meeting Times Tuesday and Thursday, 3:30pm-4:45pm, HJ Patterson 0226 Instructor: Héctor Corrada Bravo Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Department of Computer Science hcorrada@umiacs.umd.edu Office: 3114F Biomolecular Sciences Building Phone Number: 301-405-2481 Office Hours: Friday 1:00pm-2:00pm AVW 3223 (but check Piazza) and by appointment Communication: For course related questions, use Piazza as indicated below.

item.title: CMSC320: Introduction to Data Science

Check the logistics page for more information, including the official syllabus. Grades and assignments posted in ELMS.
